text: Genomic sequence upstream of the <extra_id_0> Fc gamma RIC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was cloned and subjected to primer extension analysis , which demonstrated a single transcription initiation site without a TATA box .

Transient transfections of <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter gene constructs containing various <extra_id_0> Fc gamma RIC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter sequences into U937 cells revealed that a 20-bp region surrounding the transcription start site ( -7 to +13 ) was capable of mediating transcription initiation and that an <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responsive element ( GIRE ) was present within 74 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site .
A 17-bp sequence between positions -51 and -35 conferred <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responsiveness on a heterologous promoter .
Double-stranded GIRE sequence , but not a scrambled sequence , was specifically bound by nuclear proteins from <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treated U937 cells .

Gel shift experiments further showed that the <extra_id_0> STAT1 alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein bound to the <extra_id_0> Fc gamma RIC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> GIRE in response to <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment of U937 cells .

text: The <extra_id_0> Fc gamma RIC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> GIRE is homologous to the <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation sequence ( GAS ) of the guanylate binding protein and to X box elements of class II MHC genes .

Our results demonstrate that transcriptional regulation of the <extra_id_0> Fc gamma RIC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene by <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> involves the binding of <extra_id_0> STAT1 alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to a 17-bp GAS homology in the proximal promoter .
